module.name: dti_recon
module.description: Reconstruct raw analyze/nifti images to tensors and a few other maps.

input.name: RAW_DATA
input.description: Enter the raw input data.

output.name: OUTPUT_FILE_PREFIX
output.description: This is a dummy variable used to generate the output file prefix and to carry it to the next module. The output file associated with this parameter will not exist.

input.name: output_type
input.description:
Output file type. Accepted values are: analyze -> analyze format 7.5 (NOT recommended) ni1 -> nifti format saved in seperate .hdr and .img file nii -> nifti format with one .nii file (default) nii.gz -> nifti format with compression
Default type is 'nii'

input.name: gradient_matrix
input.description: Specify the required Gradient Matrix.

input.name: b_value
input.description: Provide b value. Default is 1000.

input.name: number_of_b0
input.description: Number of b0 images. dDefault is 1. The program assumes b0 images are on top.

input.name: nex
input.description: Number of averages. Default is auto, meaning it will automatically figure out how many averages based on the gradient table and number of volumes in the 4D nifti file. Auto only works on 4D input data.

input.name: image_info
input.description: Specify image information file. The image info file is generated from original dicom image by diff_unpack program and contains image orientation and other information needed for reconstruction and tracking. By default will look into the image folder for .info file. NOTE: if info file was not found or given, the following '-iop', '-sag', '-cor', '-axial' will be used.

input.name: image_orientation_patient
input.description:
Specify image orientation vectors. Specify either a filename or 6 numerical value.
If just one argument given, will treat it as filename and read the orientation vectors from the file. If 6 arguments are given, will treat them as 6 float numbers and construct the 1st and 2nd vector and calculate the 3rd one automatically. This information will be used to determine image orientation, as well as to adjust gradient vectors with oblique angle when '-oc' flag is on.
Default use the identity matrix vectors

input.name: sagittal
input.description: This flag is equal to '-iop 0 1 0 0 0 -1'

input.name: coronal
input.description: This flag is equal to '-iop 1 0 0 0 0 -1'

input.name: axial
input.description: This flag is equal to '-iop 1 0 0 0 1 0' The above flags indicate image orientation. default is axial. NOTE: '-iop', '-sag', '-cor' and '-axial' options will overwrite what '-info' has given. usually if an .info file exists, it should be used instead of providing '-iop', etc., options manually end of image orientation options.

input.name: oblique_correction
input.description: When oblique angle(s) applied, some SIEMENS dti protocols do not adjust gradient accordingly, thus it requires adjustment for correct diffusion tensor calculation.

input.name: b0_threshold
input.description: Program will use b0 image with the given threshold to mask out high background of fa/adc maps. By default it will calculate threshold automatically, but if it failed, you need to set it manually.

input.name: no_eigen_output
input.description: Do not write eigen-value and eigen-vector output.

input.name: no_tensor_output
input.description: Do not write tensor output

input.name: no_exp_output
input.description: Do Not write exp output.

input.name: paddings
input.description:
Number of 0 paddings for input raw data file prefix.
Default value is 3

input.name: start_number
input.description: Start number of the input filename numbering. default is 1, meaning the first filename in the series is prefix001.img NOTE: '-p' and '-sn' options are only effective when a series of single timepoint image files are given. when input is a 4D time series file, those options are ignored.

input.name: help
input.description: Display Help

Each of the undersigned represents that such individual is duly authorized to execute this Agreement.
Appendix A
Description of the Software
1. Diffusion Toolkit in binary code form: Diffusion Toolkit is a software tool for the performance of data reconstruction and fiber tracking for diffusion MR imaging, utilizing but not limited to tensor data, diffusion spectrum imaging (DSI), high angular resolution diffusion imaging (HARDI) data and Q-ball imaging data.
2. TrackVis in binary code form: TrackVis is a 3-dimensional visualization program that allows real-time visualization and analysis of the fiber track data that was created by Diffusion Toolkit.

module.name: dti_tracker
module.description: Perform fiber tracking from the reconstructed tensor and maps by dti_recon and output a track file for TrackVis.

input.name: INPUT_DATA_PREFIX
input.description: Enter the input data prefix name.

input.name: input_type
input.description:
Input and output file type. Accepted values are: analyze -> analyze format 7.5 (NOT recommended) ni1 -> nifti format saved in seperate .hdr and .img file nii -> nifti format with one .nii file (default) nii.gz -> nifti format with compression
Default type is 'nii'

input.name: image_info
input.description: Specify image information file. The image info file is generated from original dicom image by diff_unpack program and contains image orientation and other information needed for reconstruction and tracking. By default will look into the image folder for .info file. NOTE: if info file was not found or given, the following '-iop', '-sag', '-cor', '-axial' will be used.

input.name: image_orientation_patient
input.description:
Specify image orientation vectors. Specify either a filename or 6 numerical value.
If just one argument given, will treat it as filename and read the orientation vectors from the file. If 6 arguments are given, will treat them as 6 float numbers and construct the 1st and 2nd vector and calculate the 3rd one automatically. This information will be used to determine image orientation, as well as to adjust gradient vectors with oblique angle when '-oc' flag is on.
Default use the identity matrix vectors

input.name: help
input.description: Display Help

input.name: runge_kutta2
input.description: Use 2nd order runge-kutta method for tracking.

input.name: tensor_line
input.description: Use tensor line method for tracking.

input.name: stream_line
input.description: Use interpolated steamline method with fixed step-length.

input.name: step_length
input.description: Set step length, in the unit of minimum voxel size. Default value is 0.5 for interpolated streamline method and 0.1 for other methods.

input.name: angle_threshold
input.description: Set angle threshold. Default is 35 degree.

input.name: random_seed
input.description: Use random location in a voxel instead of the center of the voxel to seed. Can also define number of seed per voxel. Default is 1

input.name: invert_x
input.description: Invert x component of the vector.

input.name: invert_y
input.description: Invert y component of the vector.

input.name: invert_z
input.description: Invert z component of the vector.

input.name: swapxy
input.description: Swap x & y vectors while tracking

input.name: swapyz
input.description: Swap y & z vectors while tracking

input.name: angle_threshold_weight
input.description: Set angle threshold weighting factor. Weighting will be be applied on top of the angle_threshold.

input.name: fact
input.description: Use FACT method for tracking. this is the default method.

input.name: swapzx
input.description: Swap z & x vectors while tracking

input.name: mask low threshold
input.description: Set the low Threshold.

input.name: mask high threshold
input.description: Set the highthreshold

input.name: mask file
input.description: Specify the mask file.

input.name: mask2 low threshold
input.description: Specify the low threshold for mask 2.

input.name: mask2 high threshold
input.description: Specify the high threshold for mask 2.

input.name: mask2 file
input.description: Specify the mask2 file.

input.name: output_mask
input.description: Output a binary mask file in analyze format

input.name: slice_order
input.description: Set the slice order. 1 means normal, -1 means reversed. Default value is 1 NOTE: '-iop' and '-sorder' is used to determine '-vorder' if '-vorder' is not explicitly given.

input.name: voxel_order
input.description:
Specify the voxel order in RL/AP/IS (human brain) reference. Must be 3 letters with no space in between. For example, RAS means the voxel row is from L->R, the column is from P->A and the slice order is from I->S. By default voxel order is determined by the image orientation (but NOT guaranteed to be correct because of various standards). for example, siemens axial image is LPS, coronal image is LIP and sagittal image is PIL. this information also is NOT needed for tracking but will be saved in the track file and is essential for track display to map onto the right coordinates
NOTE: .info file contains all the information for '-iop', '-sorder'and '-vorder'. so if an .info file exists, it should be used instead of applying '-iop', '-sorder' or '-vorder' manually, unless you want to overwrite what '-info' option provided.

Appendix A
Description of the Software
1. Diffusion Toolkit in binary code form: Diffusion Toolkit is a software tool for the performance of data reconstruction and fiber tracking for diffusion MR imaging, utilizing but not limited to tensor data, diffusion spectrum imaging (DSI), high angular resolution diffusion imaging (HARDI) data and Q-ball imaging data.
2. TrackVis in binary code form: TrackVis is a 3-dimensional visualization program that allows real-time visualization and analysis of the fiber track data that was created by Diffusion Toolkit.

module.name: spline_filter
module.description: Smooth and clean up the original track file generated by dti_tracker or odf_tracker.

input.name: INPUT_TRACK_FILE
input.description: Enter the input.trk file

input.name: STEP_LENGTH
input.description: Set step length, in the unit of minimum voxel size. Default value is 0.5 for interpolated streamline method and 0.1 for other methods.

module.license:
http://www.trackvis.org/docs/?subsect=license

Appendix A
Description of the Software
1. Diffusion Toolkit in binary code form: Diffusion Toolkit is a software tool for the performance of data reconstruction and fiber tracking for diffusion MR imaging, utilizing but not limited to tensor data, diffusion spectrum imaging (DSI), high angular resolution diffusion imaging (HARDI) data and Q-ball imaging data.
